info.title: JumpCloud APIs
info.description: V1 and V2 versions of JumpCloud's API.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: ObjectID of the System Group.

get.summary: List the members of a System Group
get.description: This endpoint returns _direct_ children (Systems) of this group.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return at once.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The offset into the records to return.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields used to sort the collection.
Default sort is ascending, prefix with `-` to sort descending.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields included in the returned records.
If omitted the default list of fields will be returned.

post.summary: Manage the members of a System Group
post.description: This endpoint allows you to manage the _direct_ children (Systems) of a System Group.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: ObjectID of the System Group.

get.summary: List the associations of a System Group
get.description: This endpoint returns the _direct_ associations of a System Group.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return at once.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The offset into the records to return.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields used to sort the collection.
Default sort is ascending, prefix with `-` to sort descending.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields included in the returned records.
If omitted the default list of fields will be returned.

post.summary: Manage the associations of a System Group
post.description: This endpoint allows you to manage the _direct_ associations of a System Group.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: ObjectID of the User Group.

get.summary: List the Systems associated with a User Group
get.description:
This endpoint will return Systems associated with a User Group. Each element will contain the type, id, attributes and paths.

The `attributes` object is a key/value hash of attributes specifically set for this group.

The `paths` array enumerates each path from this User Group to the corresponding System; this array represents all grouping and/or associations that would have to be removed to deprovision the System from this User Group. 

See `/members` and `/associations` endpoints to manage those collections.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return at once.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The offset into the records to return.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields used to sort the collection.
Default sort is ascending, prefix with `-` to sort descending.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields included in the returned records.
If omitted the default list of fields will be returned.

get.summary: List all System Groups
get.description:
This endpoint returns all System Groups.

Available filter fields:
  - `name`
  - `disabled`
  - `type`

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return at once.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The offset into the records to return.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields used to sort the collection.
Default sort is ascending, prefix with `-` to sort descending.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields included in the returned records.
If omitted the default list of fields will be returned.

post.description: This endpoint allows you to create a new System Group.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: ObjectID of the System Group.

get.summary: List the Users associated with a System Group
get.description:
This endpoint will return Users associated with a System Group. Each element will contain the type, id, attributes and paths.

The `attributes` object is a key/value hash of attributes specifically set for this group.

The `paths` array enumerates each path from this System Group to the corresponding User; this array represents all grouping and/or associations that would have to be removed to deprovision the User from this System Group. 

See `/members` and `/associations` endpoints to manage those collections.

parameters.description: The number of records to return at once.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The offset into the records to return.

parameters.name: sort

Default sort is ascending, prefix with `-` to sort descending.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields included in the returned records.
If omitted the default list of fields will be returned.

See `/members` and `/associations` endpoints to manage those collections.

This endpoint will return Users associated with an LDAP server instance. Each element will contain the type, id, attributes and paths.

The `attributes` object is a key/value hash of attributes specifically set for this group.

The `paths` array enumerates each path from this LDAP server instance to the corresponding User; this array represents all grouping and/or associations that would have to be removed to deprovision the User from this LDAP server instance. 

See `/members` and `/associations` endpoints to manage those collections.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return at once.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The offset into the records to return.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields used to sort the collection.
Default sort is ascending, prefix with `-` to sort descending.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The comma separated fields included in the returned records.
If omitted the default list of fields will be returned.

parameters.name: ldapserver_id
parameters.description: ObjectID of the LDAP Server.

id.description: ObjectId uniquely identifying a User Group.

name.description: Display name of a User Group.

PolicyTemplate.title: PolicyTemplate
PolicyTemplate.description: A representation of a possible policy instance.

id.description: ObjectId uniquely indetifying a Policy Template.

name.description: The default display name for the Policy.

description.description: The default description for the Policy.

valid.description: A list of all the operating systems, by version, and whether or not this policy can be applied to it.

mac.description: Key value pair (version being the key, true/false being the value).

windows.description: Key value pair (version being the key, true/false being the value).

config.description: The dynamic config options for this particular policy template. Works like the Application Template configuration.

op.description: How to modify the membership connection.

id.description: The ObjectID of member being added or removed.

GraphConnection.title: GraphConnection
GraphConnection.description: Represents an edge between two graph objects. From can be omitted if it is clear from context.

id.description: The ObjectID of the graph object.

name.description: Display name of a User Group.

op.description: How to modify the graph connection.

id.description: The ObjectID of graph object being added or removed as an association.

Policy.title: Policy
Policy.description: An instance of a policty template.

policyTemplateID.description: The Policy Template that this Policy was created from.

organizationID.description: The organization that this Policy is for.

active.description: Whether or not this Policy is currently active.

name.description: The description for this specific Policy.

description.description: The description for this specific Policy.

os.description: The operating system that this policy belongs to.

systemCount.description: For convenience. The number of systems that this policy is attached to.

config.description: The specific configuration for this Policy.

attributes.description: The compiled graph attributes of the target object.

id.description: Object ID of this graph object.

paths.description: A path through the graph between two graph objects.

name.description: Display name of a System Group.

id.description: ObjectId uniquely identifying a System Group.

type.description: The type of the group; always 'system' for a User Group.

name.description: Display name of a System Group.

op.description: How to modify the membership connection.

id.description: The ObjectID of member being added or removed.
